edu.bu.segrelab.comets
Class ModelFileException

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Throwable
      java.lang.Exception
          edu.bu.segrelab.comets.ModelFileException
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ModelFileException
extends java.lang.Exception

A ModelFileException is an exception used for issues with a loaded model file (or not loaded, as the exception may be...). This is a way to lump together problems from multiple types of exceptions - FileNotFound, NumberFormat, IO, etc. Thus, along with the usual constructors, there's also separate constructors that take an additional integer, to be chosen from the constants below. This integer signifies the actual problem.

Author:
Bill Riehl
See Also:

Constructor Detail

ModelFileException

public ModelFileException()
Makes a generic new ModelFileException

ModelFileException

public ModelFileException(java.lang.String msg)
Makes a new ModelFileException with a specific String message.

Parameters:
msg - - an informational message about the nature of the exception.

ModelFileException

public ModelFileException(int error)
Makes a new ModelFileException with a specific error code.

The error parameter should be one of the following:
ModelFileException.FILE_NOT_FOUND
ModelFileException.NUMBER_FORMAT_ERROR
ModelFileException.IO_ERROR

Parameters:
error - - the error code for this ModelFileException.

ModelFileException

public ModelFileException(int error,
                          java.lang.String msg)
Makes a new ModelFileException with a specific error code and error message. The error code should be chosen as in ModelFileException(int).

Parameters:
error - - the error code for this ModelFileException.
msg - - an informational message about the nature of the exception.
Method Detail

getError

public int getError()
Returns:
the error code for this exception: one of FILE_NOT_FOUND, NUMBER_FORMAT_ERROR, or IO_ERROR.
